fields.title: Joyou AG plans IPO in the Prime Standard on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange
fields.content:
·       IPO pursued for the first half of 2010

·       Issue volume of more than EUR 100 million targeted
·       Market leading specialist for branded faucets and other sanitary ware products in China
·       Strong sales and profit growth rates over last years
 
Frankfurt, 11 March 2010. Joyou AG intends to go public in the first half of 2010 and aims to obtain a listing in the Prime Standard on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange. The company with its operating business located in China designs, produces and sells faucets and other sanitary ware products in China under its brand name "Joyou". It is also engaged as a manufacturer of Original Equipment Manufacturing/Original Design Manufacturing products for international sanitary ware companies, wholesalers and trading companies in the United States, Europe and Asia.
Strong market position in China
Joyou is one of the leading single-brand manufacturers of bathroom, kitchen and other faucets in China in terms of revenues and was founded over 20 years ago. Joyou has established an extensive retail distribution network in China with 2,527 retail points of sale as of 31 December 2009. The size of its production facilities enables Joyou to benefit from economies of scale by sourcing raw materials, finished products and production equipment more cost efficiently as it can purchase these items in larger quantities. Joyou intends to double the number of its retail points of sale in the next three to four years with a special focus on flagship stores and exclusive stores. The current trend to urbanization, rising wealth and retail consumption levels as well as the growth of the Chinese middle classes are expected to have a favourable impact on the sanitary ware industry in China and on Joyou’s business.
Strong sales and profit growth rates
 
Joyou''s total revenues increased from EUR 44.9 million in 2007 to EUR 135.0 million in 2008 and to EUR 172.3 million in 2009, corresponding to a compound annual growth rate of 96% over this period. The operating profit (EBIT) of Joyou grew by a compound annual growth rate of 97%: from EUR 10.0 million in 2007 to EUR 25.0 million in 2008 and to EUR 39.0 million in 2009. Correspondingly, net profits of the company increased by a compound annual growth rate of 69%: from EUR 7.8 million in 2007 to EUR 16.1 million in 2008 and to EUR 22.3 million in 2009. Joyou had an average number of 2,503 employees in 2009.


International expansion
Currently Joyou generates approx. 80% of sales in the fast growing Chinese sanitary ware market and China will remain the main focus of the company’s activities. Joyou is considering entering selected overseas markets in the medium-term with a strong partner or with its own salespeople to sell its own brand products, as the company believes that there are business opportunities for high-quality products such as its own brand products at competitive prices.
Listing in the Prime Standard on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange
 
The company is planning a public offer in Germany and Luxembourg as well as private placements to institutional investors outside Germany, Luxembourg and the United States. All of the shares for the basic transaction are coming from a capital increase with the objective of raising more than EUR 100 million. Shares owned by the existing shareholders are being placed in the context of the over-allotment option (Greenshoe Option).
 
Macquarie Capital (Europe) Limited and China International Capital Corporation Hong Kong Securities Limited (CICC) are acting as Joint Global Coordinators and Joint Bookrunners. Further syndicate banks are WestLB AG and DZ BANK AG.
 
Joyou plans to use the net proceeds that it will receive from the sale of the new shares to finance the further expansion of Joyou. In particular, Joyou plans to acquire a ceramic sanitary ware company, to establish new production facilities for certain sanitary ware products, to expand its faucet production capacity and to establish galvanization lines for showerheads. The company also plans to establish approximately 1,000 additional retail points of sale in China, a dedicated brand advertising campaign with its brand ambassador in China, Guo JingJing, a well-known Chinese sports athlete, and to finance other corporate purposes such as the further strengthening of financial, IT and risk management systems.
About Joyou
Joyou designs, produces and sells faucets and other sanitary ware products in China under its brand name "Joyou" and is also engaged as a manufacturer for international brands and trading companies in the United States and Europe as well as other emerging markets. Joyou is one of the leading single-brand manufacturers of bathroom, kitchen and other faucets in China in terms of revenues. Joyou has established an extensive distribution network in China with 2,527 retail points of sales as of 31 December 2009. Joyou''s operating facilities are based in Nan''an near Quanzhou in Fujian Province in China. Joyou''s five main product groups sold in its own brand business are bathroom faucets, kitchen products, shower products as well as other bathroom products and other faucets and sanitary hardware. In 2009, Joyou realised group revenues of EUR 172 million, an operating profit (EBIT) of EUR 39.0 million and a net profit of EUR 22.3 million employing on average 2,503 persons.

fields.content:

·       Strategic partnership with Grohe
·       Strong sales growth and sustained net earnings margin of more than 12.9%
 
Frankfurt, 22 March 2010. Joyou AG, a leading manufacturer for faucets and a specialist for other sanitary ware products in China, intends to go public on 30 March 2010. Joyou aims to obtain a listing on the Regulated Market (Prime Standard) of the Frankfurt Stock Exchange.
 
The Offering consists of a public offering in Germany and Luxembourg and private placements to institutional investors outside Germany, Luxembourg and the United States. It consists of up to 8,050,000 no par value ordinary bearer shares (Inhaberstückaktien) of Joyou AG, each having a notional amount of the share capital of EUR 1.00 and each vested with full dividend rights for the entire financial year 2010. Of this amount, up to 7,000,000 no par value ordinary bearer shares originate from a capital increase against cash contributions. The company aims to raise more than EUR 100 million from the capital increase. Up to 1,050,000 no par value ordinary shares will be made available by the Greenshoe Shareholders in connection with a potential over-allotment (Greenshoe).
 
The offer period is expected to begin on 23 March 2010 and to end on 26 March 2010. On the last day of the offer period, retail investors may submit offers to purchase shares until 12:00 noon and other investors until 6:00 pm (CET).
 
Macquarie Capital (Europe) Limited and China International Capital Corporation Hong Kong Securities Limited (CICC) are acting as Joint Global Coordinators and Joint Bookrunners. WestLB AG and DZ BANK AG are acting as Co-Lead Managers.

In particular, Joyou plans to acquire a ceramic sanitary ware company, to establish new production facilities for certain sanitary ware products, to expand its faucet production capacity and to establish galvanization lines for showerheads. The company also plans to establish approximately 1,000 additional retail points of sale in China, a dedicated brand advertising campaign with its brand ambassador in China, Guo JingJing, a well-known Chinese athlete, and to finance other corporate purposes such as the strengthening of financial, IT and risk management systems.

In October 2009, Joyou entered into a distribution agreement with Grohe under which Joyou agreed to act as a distributor for Grohe branded products on the Chinese market. fields.title: Joyou makes successful stock market debut
fields.content:
Frankfurt, 30 March 2010. Joyou AG, a leading manufacturer of bathroom, kitchen and other faucets and a specialist in other sanitary ware products in China, started trading successfully today at the Frankfurt stock exchange. The first share price of 14,75 Euro was 13,5 percent higher than the placement price of 13,00 Euro. At EUR 14.75 the market capitalisation of Joyou amounts to more than EUR 350 million.

 
“The successful start on stock market confirms the tremendous interest shown by German and international blue chip investors in our company," says Jianshe Cai, CEO of Joyou AG. "We are delighted that so many investors have found our story convincing. We are looking forward to build a long term relationship with our shareholders."
The issue volume amounts to about EUR 105 million including EUR 14 million from over-allotment. The company will be receiving gross proceeds of EUR 91 million from the placement. The free float will amount to about 33.6 percent on the basis of the fully exercised Greenshoe option.
A total of 8,050,000 shares were placed in the Joyou AG IPO. 7,000,000 of these shares originated from a capital increase against cash contributions and 1,050,000 shares originated from the Greenshoe Shareholders in connection with an over-allotment (Greenshoe).
With this IPO Joyou realized the largest capital raise of any Chinese company in Germany so far.
The offering was more than two times over-subscribed and the shares were allocated as follows: Approx. 50 percent of the shares were allocated to investors from UK. fields.title: Joyou opens more than 250 stores in Q1
fields.content:
Hamburg, Germany, 10 May 2010. Joyou AG, a leading manufacturer for faucets and a specialist for other sanitary ware products in China, opened 253 new points of sale in the first quarter of 2010.

 
The company therefore had a network of 2,780 sales outlets throughout China as at 31 March 2010. In the same period of last year, Joyou opened 101 new stores. It therefore achieved growth of approximately 150 per cent in Q1 2010. Opening new stores is one of Joyou AG’s primary growth drivers.
 
Most of the new outlets have been opened in small and medium-sized Chinese cities (tier 3 and tier 4), resulting in growth figures of 179 per cent and 165 per cent respectively in the first quarter of the current year. This is in line with the company’s strategy of focusing its growth on smaller and medium-sized locations in particular.
Joyou AG intends to increase its number of stores to 4,500 by 2013.
500 Grohe stores planned

To do so, Joyou intends to open some 500 sales outlets in 2010. The first Grohe stores have already been opened.

fields.title: Joyou acquires galvanization plant in China
fields.content:
Ad-hoc release according to § 15 WpHG

Joyou acquires galvanization plant in China

Hamburg, Germany, 24 September 2010. Joyou AG, a leading manufacturer of bathroom, kitchen and other faucets and a specialist in other sanitary ware products in China, intends to acquire a 100% stake in Yongsheng Galvanization Industrial Co. Ltd., a galvanization plant in the Shui Tou Galvanisation Industry Park in Nan’an, Fujian Province. The acquisition has been approved by the supervisory board and is expected to be completed within 1 month. The total investment volume of the acquisition amounts to EUR 12.2 million (RMB 106 million). As planned, Joyou will therewith invest parts of the proceeds of its IPO in order to expand the capacity of its existing galvanization lines.

The galvanization plant, Quanzhou Yongsheng Galvanization Industrial Co. Ltd. was established in March 2010 in the Shui Tou Galvanisation Industrial Park and specializes in galvanization for international and domestic sanitary ware brands. Due to its increase in production, Joyou’s current galvanization capacities are insufficient to meet expected future demand. The Yongsheng plant currently has over 100 employees and a galvanisation capacity of some 45,625,000 pieces per year.

Additional information:

In response to the environmental impact of the Galvanisation Process, the PRC government has ceased issuing new galvanisation licenses and seriously curtailed expansion of current galvanisation lines. It was for this reason, that the 200,000 sqm Shui Tou Galvanisation Industry Park was established. It is a government controlled centralized galvanization facility set up to tackle environmental issues related to the galvanization process.

“It was due to this constraint, and that a Greenfield construction in the Shui Tou Galvanisation Industry Park was ruled out due to the facilities current capacity constraints, that Joyou AG intends to acquire the Yongsheng Galvanization Industrial Co. Ltd. thereby ensuring that it will have sufficient capacity to fulfil its future expansion plans”, explains JOYOU CEO Jianshe Cai.

fields.title: Joyou sets up new plant for ceramics products
fields.content:
Ad-hoc release according to § 15 WpHG

Joyou sets up new plant for ceramics products

Hamburg, Germany, 19 November 2010. Joyou Group ("Joyou") intends to set up a new plant for ceramic sanitary ware products, such as basins, toilets, and similar ceramic products. The investment for the project amounts to approximately RMB 350 million (EUR 38.8 million) for the production facilities and a further RMB 70 million (EUR 7.8 million) for working capital which will be funded from operations. Parts of Joyou AG''s proceeds from its IPO in March 2010 will be used to finance the project. The project has been approved by the supervisory board and commencement of operations is expected for the second quarter of 2011.

As the Chinese economy continues its high growth and rapid urbanization path, demand for ceramic sanitary ware products continues to increase. In part this increase is also due to the strong adoption of Western urban living styles and increased income per capita. Joyou currently sells ceramic sanitary ware products under the Joyou brand, however, production of such products is at present outsourced to third-party manufacturers.

By bringing in-house this ceramics manufacturing capability, Joyou believes it will gain better quality and cost control, and hence be able to provide improved service to customers. Moreover, this will also significantly increase Joyou’s gross margins compared to the current outsourcing strategy. A further goal is to increase Joyou''s success in selling to the project business segment, such as new residential, office, or hotel developments, where purchases are normally made directly from the manufacturer.

The new production site, which will include two new factory workshops, will be located in Meiyu Industrial Park, Luncang Town, Nan’an City, Fujian Province, in the PRC, on a land plot of approximately 140,000 sqm. In the first phase after commencement of operations, the production capacity of the plant is expected to reach about 1.8 million - 2 million units per year.

During the preparations for its IPO, Joyou still envisaged the acquisition of an existing ceramic sanitary ware company. However, after evaluating all available opportunities, management came to the conclusion that building of new production facilities is the preferable solution.

fields.title: Grohe andJoyou combine forces in Global Strategic Initiative – One plus one is greater than two
fields.summary: The Chief Marketing Officer of Grohe AG Gverry Mulvin and the Regional Vice President of Grohe AG Chen Yongxing sat for an interview with Home.sohu.com in Diaoyutai, China:
fields.content:
The Chief Marketing Officer of Grohe AG Gverry Mulvin and the Regional Vice President of Grohe AG Chen Yongxing sat for an interview with Home.sohu.com in Diaoyutai, China:

 

Date: November 15, 2009

 

[Hu Yanli, Interviewer]: First of all, I really appreciate that you have given me this chance to interview you on behalf of Home.sohu.com. I would like to start off by asking, Why are Joyou and Grohe starting this strategic initiative?

 

[Gverry Mulvin]: There are three main reasons: First, Grohe has a strong International sales network, which will, no doubt, assist Joyou in opening up global markets. Second, Joyou has an extensive sales network in China which compliments Grohe''s current sales network in China. We believe that one plus one is greater than two and it will enable Grohe to develop faster in China. Third, we hope that the cooperation with Joyou will not only make our global image and brand better, but also add some elements of Chinese culture into our brand and image so as to be closer to Chinese consumers.

 

[Hu Yanli]: Could you explain some of the specifics of your cooperation with Joyou?

 

[Gverry Mulvin]: I can give you the following example: Grohe has good penetration in markets all around the world, but our products sold in GMS, for example, in East European countries, are only high-end. We currently lack mid-range to high-end products. The cooperation with Joyou is a good fit because they can fill in the blanks of mid-range consumer products. Judging from our current sales network, we think that we can grow rapidly in China and fill in the blanks in many second, third and fourth-tier cities through cooperation with Joyou. Currently, Grohe’s products in China are aimed at the high-end market. We have 115 stores and we hope that Grohe, with Joyou AG''s cooperation, will establish 500 to 600 stores in the next 6 to 12 months. With these new locations we will be able to serve consumers better and bring German technology, design and quality to more points of sale in China.

 

[Hu Yanli]: You have mentioned your expectations with regards to cooperation with Joyou in China. I would like to know how China fits into Grohe''s global strategy.

 

[Gverry Mulvin]: China is one of the three main strategic priorities for the headquarters of Grohe AG; the other two being the USA and Germany where we hope Grohe can continue to be a leader in high-end products. With respect to the importance of the China market, there are at least 40 million people moving from rural areas to cities annually. This is a great opportunity for us to sell more high-quality Grohe brand products. To put this into perspective, 40 million people is equivalent to the total urbanized population of other countries. Grohe AG hopes to capture a big part of that market in China. In conclusion, we can complete our product line and our sales network through this cooperation.

 

[Hu Yanli]: As the general director in China, what do you think of China’s market performance under the uncertain market conditions?

 

[Chen Yongxing]: Grohe AG has very good performance in China and its performance in the second, third and fourth quarters increased by over 30 percentage points in comparison with those of previous year. Despite the financial crisis, even the first quarter showed some growth. At present, China is becoming a major contributor for Grohe AG, both in sales amount and profit. Therefore, business cooperation in China is becoming more important for Grohe.

 

[Hu Yanli]: Can you outline the reasons for the 30% growth?

 

[Chen Yongxing]: We have grown in both retail sales and engineering. Sales of many competitors this year are worse than last year, but we have grown. We hope that we will be able to match fast growth in China as well as in Germany.

Joyou kicked off the 2010 National Joyou Distributors Conference at Quanzhou Olympic Park on January 8, 2010. Mr. Lin Jin, marketing advisor of Joyou Sanitation and Sanitary Ware Industry “Guru”, provided a brilliant opening speech with the theme of "The Joyou Brand, The Next Chapter" for two thousand of the top distributors from all over China. Top executives of Joyou also attended the conference.

 
 
 

At the conference, Mr. Lin resumed Joyou''''s marketing policy with the focus on being competitive in the end-user marketing channel. He pointed out that the sanitary ware industry has entered into the age of "Pinpoint Marketing", which relies on a comprehensive distribution channel. He quoted from his personal experience to help distributors achieve a global understanding of the "Pinpoint Marketing" within the marketing channel.

 

Secondly, he pointed out that the sanitary ware industry is currently in a process of industrial consolidation, and that sanitary ware distributors must adapt by renovating themselves from the ground up. The key upgrade being the “talent.” The boom in the sanitary ware industry poses an unprecedented challenge to talent nurturing and team building for distributors. Therefore, to remain successful in a very competitive market, the distributors need to hone the competitiveness and creativity of their teams with continuous training and professional development.

 
 
 

Lin''''s presentation energized the audience. Through this meeting, participating distributors gained a deeper understanding of Joyou''''s marketing policy, channel expansion, team building, and the retail store system.

This conference successfully achieved it''''s aim to outline the initiatives of Joyou''''s distributors to further expand the market, exploit niche channels effectively and promote the Joyou brand.

The executives of Joyou Group also presented their determination and ambition to compete with domestic high-end sanitary ware brands. In the future, the ambitious, diligent and creative people of Joyou will strive to become the No.1 sanitary ware brand in China.

fields.content:
GROHE, Europe’s market leader in sanitary fittings, kicked off the Grohe China Distribution Conference with the theme of "Teamwork in a solid partnership" at Quanzhou Hotel. Sanity-ware distributors from all over China participated in the conference which was attended by David Haines (CEO of Grohe AG), Gerry Mulvin (CMO of Grohe AG), Yongxin Chen (Global Strategic Investment and Cooperation President of Grohe AG), Bin Niao(secretary-general of China Building Ceramics & Sanitaryware Association), Lixin Jin (Secretary-General of China National Hardware Association), Jiyong Leng (Distribution Supervisor of CIMEN Architectural Material Co., Ltd), Jianshe Cai (Board Chairman of Joyou Group), Jilin Cai Joyou''s Chief Operating Officer (COO), Wenwu Lin (Deputy Marketing Supervisor).

 

Dozens of national media outlets such as Fujian TV, Quanzhou TV, Straits News, Sohu Focus Home, and Soufun.com, reported on the event.

 

Mr. David Haines delivered an impassioned speech and expressed confidence in the Grohe/Joyou Partnership. Grohe''s well-known brand is a perfect match with Joyou''s extensive distribution network, and it''s determination to build the top brand in the Chinese market. Mr. Cai welcomed interested distributors and briefly introduced the Future objectives and direction of the Grohe brand in China. The final speakers, Ke Chen (Grohe Brand Distribution Manager for the Joyou Group) and Zhenhong Zhao (Product Technology Director) introduced Grohe''s marketing policy and product series for 2010.

 

The Grohe Brand Operation Center established by Joyou Group has developed an efficient policy for the marketing of Grohe products in 2010, and a strong marketing team has been established to accomplish the strategic development goals of Grohe to make Grohe the top high-end brand of China as quick as possible. At the same time, both Grohe and Joyou will work together to increase the international market share for both brands.

 

Grohe unveiled it''s plans for a cooperative and efficient nation-wide operation network oriented towards brand building and upholding the principles of equality, integrity, win-win cooperation, and resource sharing. Grohe will supply products from it''s G2 to G7 series, all of which will be imported. The products are specially designed for China''s corporate and retail markets, making them especially competitive. Likewise, Grohe will provide support for distributors, including store decoration, new store opening, sub-distribution development, effective advertising investment, and unique support for growth in engineering projects. Furthermore, Grohe will carry out periodic sales training for distributors, including store opening, sales skills and sales guidance. Regular on-line training videos will also be provided to promote upgrades and improvements.

 

Grohe, Europe’s market leader in sanitary fittings, offered preferential policies to attract distributors, many of which expressed their intent to cooperate and their confidence in the Grohe brand. At the end of the conference, many cooperation “letters of intent” were signed between Mr. Cai Jilin and senior brand agents, bringing the event to a successful close.

 

Mr. Cai concluded the conference by mentioning: "Grohe not only enjoys strong technical support and brand awareness, but they also have proven marketing channels and sales management systems. The global strategic partnership between Joyou and Grohe will consolidate the advantageous resources of both brands to exploit the Asia Pacific market, and with the involvement of numerous competitive distributors, Grohe will soon accomplish a new round of leap-forward development in the Chinese market. It can be expected that Grohe will quickly accomplish the goal of becoming a leading high-end sanitary-ware brand in China!"

fields.title: Joyou''s First Supplier Conference – Win-win Cooperation & Mutual Development
fields.summary: Joyou held its'' first annual Supplier Conference at Quanzhou Hotel on January 10, 2010. The main aim of the conference was to lay out the new Comprehensive Procurement Plan based on the principles of ..
fields.content:
Joyou held its'' first annual Supplier Conference at Quanzhou Hotel on January 10, 2010. The main aim of the conference was to lay out the new Comprehensive Procurement Plan based on the principles of cooperation and mutual benefit. The theme of the conference was "Over the Top and beyond with Joyou."

 

Over 300 of Joyou''s top suppliers came face-to-face at the conference with Mr. Jilin Cai, Chief Operating Officer (COO), Mr. Minsheng Shi (Product Division Manager of the Quanzhou Branch of China Minsheng Banking Corp., Ltd), Mr. Kaifang Cai (Supply Chain Supervisor), Mr. Huangyao Hong (Administration Supervisor), Mr. Yujia Li (Production Center Supervisor ), Mr. Wenwu Lin (Marketing Supervisor), Mr. Tiansheng Zeng (QC Supervisor of Joyou Group), and Mr. Li Wu(Technical Supervisor).

 

Mr. Cai addressed the conference outlining key points of the conference: "Joyou has greatly improved brand promotion, strategic cooperation, management reform and team & network building in 2009. Both the market and the Joyuo brand expanded at an impressive rate – a new chapter of Joyou''s development." He introduced the future globalization development strategy of Joyou and challenged the suppliers to assist in strengthening capital investment, carrying out rigid quality control, and improving supply capacity. Mr. Cai concluded by saying: "Joyou will strive to maintain long-term and stable partnerships with all suppliers through better communication and mutual benefit.”

 

At the conference, suppliers and Joyou jointly summed up the procurement process for 2009 and carried out broad and in-depth discussions of existing weak points, while proposing feasible solutions. Based on these discussions, top suppliers of 2009 were rewarded for outstanding performance, setting standards for the others. Top Supplier Awards were based on purchase amounts (a primary indicator), quality of supply (a primary indicator), punctuality of supply, price, cost savings, and degree of adaptability, with awards being classified into three categories: AAA, AA and A. Winners included Fenghua Yongda Stainless Steel Ceramic Co., Ltd, WDI (Xiamen) Technology Inc and Shenzhen Kangqin Trade Co., Ltd. In addition to praising winners, Joyou Group laid the groundwork for broader procurement cooperation in 2010, including new product development, order allocation and capital turnover policies. The next speaker, Yujia Li, Production Supervisor, continued the conference by outlining the Production Material Demand Plan for 2010. Tiansheng Zeng (QC Supervisor) introduced the quality control criteria for purchased materials, while Guozhu Ke(Purchasing Manager) explained the purchasing policies. The talks were not uni-directional; all participators took part in Joyou''s supply chain consolidation & development planning for 2010, allowing seamless and efficient cooperation between Joyou and major suppliers.

 

According to Kaifang Cai, Joyou will implement the new Supplier Management System throughout 2010, with three interconnected points: development of a comprehensive "Joyou Group Supplier Manual", vigorous promotion of standardization and institutionalization of the supply chain, while further improving and implementing the supplier evaluation system. Meanwhile, Joyou will strengthen the quality supervision, provide relevant training, and enhance the information exchange with suppliers, so as to build a sound supply flow and achieve win-win cooperation. Mr. Cai emphasized, "The construction of a robust supply chain system, improved supply chain efficiency and establishment of a strategic partnerships with key suppliers will become the highlights of Joyou''s procurement project in 2010. Joyou will proactively promote cooperation with key suppliers who are willing to grow along with Joyou to develop a robust and efficient supplier team."

 

Mr. Cai concluded, "This supplier conference has been extremely successful. Joyou''s procurement policy for 2010 has been fully implemented, the exchange with extensive suppliers has been strengthened, and the level of cooperation has advanced to a new level, laying a solid foundation for a new round of rapid development for Joyou. This conference also reflects Joyou''s determination to be a trendsetter in the sanitary-ware industry and to build a high-end domestic brand in China."

The environmentally-friendly waster-saving designs with an elegant appearance of these new products lines captured everyone’s attention.

fields.title: Joyou Holds a factory tour during the 2010 Distributor Annual Meeting
fields.summary: Approximately 2,000 Joyou distributors from all over China were invited to tour the new Joyou factory. They visited Joyou''s production base in order to better understand the secrets of Joyou''s 30 year..
fields.content:
Approximately 2,000 Joyou distributors from all over China were invited to tour the new Joyou factory. They visited Joyou''s production base in order to better understand the secrets of Joyou''s 30 years of continual advancement.

 

According to Jilin Cai, Chief Operating Officer (COO), “Joyou is devoted to providing customers with comfortable, healthy, environmentally-friendly and stylish sanitary-ware products and plumbing fixtures. Joyou has introduced state-of-the-art production facilities such as a KWC low-pressure casting machine from Switzerland, gravity casting machinery from Korea, automatic buffing machinery from Italy, and a fully automatic plating line from Switzerland, forming a complete production line from copper smelting to product assembly, inspection and warehousing. These facilities allow Joyou to manufacture high quality products with a low defect rate, while expanding market share and fulfilling the commitment of “Harmonizing Life with Water."

 

The distributors, lead by guides, inspected every point of the production line from die casting, to tool finishing, buffing, galvanization and the final assembly. They marveled at the precise and complicated production process of faucets and the rigid quality control at each station. Everything in the workshop was in good order, and employees in uniform worked in full swing at their posts, well reflecting the cohesive strength of Joyou''s staff. Many distributors noted that they initially doubted the new brand proposition of Joyou, but that now they were inspired by the strength, determination and confidence of Joyou.

 

At the exhibition room, guests learned about the 30-year development history of Joyou, dispaying all the master pieces developed and manufactured by Joyou''s Engineering Department throughout its'' history, including new products to be launched in 2010. Distributors took photos and asked questions. The main showroom was especially crowded by visitors who praised the look. Many of them showed interest in upgrading their specialty stores adapting the new, elegant style. When the factory tour came to an end, a distributor from Shanghai said: "This visit to the factory has made me feel extremely confident about our products!"

 

Mr. Cai concluded the tour, by stating: "The Joyou factory is open to field inspection by any and all distributors, confident that Joyou''s high-quality products will always stand up to inspection. Furthermore, distributors can experience first-hand the manufacturing process of Joyou''s products from start to finish, helping them better serve customers with greater confidence and strengthened team building, which will be a powerful weapon to face severe market competition."

fields.title: Joyou Showcases Products at ISH China 2010 – Beijing
fields.summary: The three-day ISH China 2010 (International Trade Fair of Heating & Air Conditioning, Sanitary Ware, and Urban Construction Equipment and Technology) was held in the Beijing National Convention Center..
fields.content:
The three-day ISH China 2010 (International Trade Fair of Heating & Air Conditioning, Sanitary Ware, and Urban Construction Equipment and Technology) was held in the Beijing National Convention Center from March 10th to 12th. Joyou competed with enterprises from the USA, Switzerland, Spain, France, Japan, Taiwan, etc. Joyou''s competitive line of products attracted a lot of attention from professionals and consumers alike.

 

Taps – The Main Product Line

 

Among Joyou''s many products on display, taps are still its most competitive product and the driving force behind the Joyou brand. Through the perfect marriage of art and technology, all product lines combine classic charm and materials with new technology. For example, the elegant design of the “Lady Series” represents the beauty of the feminine curves and shape; products of the “Gallop Series” are angular and exude masculinity; while taps of the “Nature Series” are simple and gracefully refined, leaving the user with a feeling of calm. The Joyou Exhibition areas were flooded with curious consumers and professionals – anxious to discuss cooperation. Commenting on the draw of Joyou''s taps at the exhibit, Zhenhong Zhao, product manager, said that Joyou''s core concept is based on scientific and technological research which is applied to the development and manufacture of new products. Ergonomic and environmentally friendly designs reflect consumer demand.

 

Intelligent Toilets

 

Intelligent technology, elegant design and human engineering are part of this product series. A few examples of the technology ergonomically integrated into the designs are the heated seat-ring, the warm air dryer, a LED display, memory energy conservation and a seat switch for automatic opening and closing. All the products are environmentally-friendly, clean, fashionable and elegant. These water-saving designs include efficient sludge discharge pipes and multi-layer glazing.

 

Showers

 

Meanwhile, Joyou''s shower pillar series did not go unnoticed. The pillar includes a knob-type 180-degree shunt valve and switch which can be turned 360 degrees, allowing for both high and low adjustments. Likewise, they do not deform when used with water at or below 70°C and they have a water pressure limit of 0.86MPa. To top it off, the large shower-head provides optimal water cover and variety with the following spray modes: full/body message combo, waterfall, and bubble water. Perfect designs combining technology and ergonomics set Joyou’s shower pillar series above the others at the exhibition.

 

During the exhibition, CCTV, Sina, Sohu, SouFun, Xingbang Ceramics, China Jieju and other major media outlets focused on Joyou''s products. Mr. Cai , CCO of Joyou AG, said in an interview, “Joyou has made steady progress and become one of the leading enterprises in the industry thanks to excellent quality, industry leading R&D technology, improved production techniques and elegant designs. Meanwhile, Joyou has successfully participated in key trade shows at home and abroad for many years, due in large part to thorough preparation – site selection, exhibition room designs, product displays, promotion channels and continuous innovation. This exhibition has come to a favorable conclusion giving Joyou renewed energy to continue innovating in the future.”

A New round of swift development has been witnessed since Joyou was listed on the market. fields.title: Double Win: Joyou Listed in Europe and Awarded Marketing Prize
fields.summary: In only a few months Joyou has been doubly blessed. Joyou not only made headway into a top capital market and the strongest sanitary ware country in Europe, but also won the Golden Tripod prize which ..
fields.content:
Picture: in the studio during the Golden Tripod Marketing Award Ceremony for Outstanding Marketing in China, the host of Shandong TV (Right) interviewing Joyou''s Chief Operating Officer, Jilin Cai (Left).

 

Joyou trades above offer price

 

On March 30, Reuters reported on the initial public offering of Joyou (DAX:JY8) on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange. The stock increased 16% in comparison with the offering price. Joyou successfully listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange at EUR 14.75 a share with a total IPO financing of EUR 105 million, making Joyou the largest Chinese enterprise on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange.

 

Joyou awarded the Golden Tripod Prize for Outstanding Marketing

 

On July 18, Joyou''s COO, Jilin Cai, and China’s richest man Qinghou Zong were awarded Golden Tripod Awards for being China’s most outstanding marketers in the studios of Shandong TV in a ceremony jointly sponsored by China Marketing Magazine.

 

In only a few months Joyou has been doubly blessed. Joyou not only made headway into a top capital market and the strongest sanitary ware country in Europe, but also won the Golden Tripod prize which is the highest award for Chinese marketers – also known as the Oscar of China’s marketing industry. These achievements show Joyou’s development, both in brand building and financing to take advantage of the world''s largest market.

 

In 2008 same year, Jilin Cai, Joyou COO, assumed the responsibility to enter the domestic market and establish the Joyou brand, leading the domestic marketing team to set up distribution networks in first-tier and second-tier cities all over the country. In total, 3,000 points-of-sale were opened, including national flagship stores, exclusive shops and shops-in-shops.

 

Meanwhile, the brand image of Joyou has been rapidly developed. This brand growth has been recognized by important national awards including: Chinese Famous Brand Products, and Famous Trademark of China. Likewise, during the 2008 Olympic Games in Beijing, Joyou cooperated with volunteers from Beijing colleges and universities to create "Smile of Beijing” to service the Olympics. Moreover, at the end of 2009, Jingjing Guo, the Olympic diving champion and highly respected Chinese gold-medal athlete, was invited to be Joyou''s brand ambassador to explain the second phase of the major brand marketing campaign titled “Joyou, Water of Life”.

 

Joyou continued its marketing plan by establishing a comprehensive strategic partnership with Grohe of Germany. At the beginning of 2010, Joyou also cooperated with the famous Chinese prime-time program “Happy Trip across China”. Thousands of Joyou’s dealers and tens of thousands of audience members participated in the program recording. Sponsorship of this popular national program laid the foundation for continued rapid growth of Joyou''s domestic marketing in 2010. Receiving the Golden Tripod Marketing Award attests to the rapid positioning of the Joyou brand in the national market, but not without a lot of hard work and marketing prowess. When demands in the international market began to shrink two years ago, many export oriented enterprises adopted domestic sales as the expedient measure in the wait-and-see phase. Jilin Cai did his utmost to lead his team to rapidly establish 3,000 points of sale in China, with company performance doubling after only one year. He overcame the business risks with speed and enabled domestic sales to become an important part of the enterprise, making Joyou a leader in the sanitary ware industry. This rapid growth has been followed by international capital.

 

With regard to China''s market trends, experts in the industry believe that domestic consumption is developing towards channel marketing and brand-based economy with consumers looking for quality that top brands inherently bring. Following these market trends with sound network channels in the sanitary ware industry, Joyou has positioned itself as the largest manufacturer of sanitary ware products and accessories in Fujian province and one of the largest enterprises for exporting taps and copper valves in Asia. In 2009, Joyou enjoyed a net profit of EUR 22.3 million and revenue of EUR 172.3 million, with the lions share of 80% coming from the domestic market. The enormous development opportunity of China''s sanitary ware market, combined with Joyou''s strong brand recognition, have lead the capital markets to give a vote of confidence by investing in Joyou''s future potential.

fields.content:
On April 9, the municipal government of Quanzhou came to Joyou for an inspection / visit. Since Joyou''s successful listing on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange, it has become the most important enterprise to be inspected by them. The goal of this inspection focused on finding out more details about Joyou''s development and financial situation since the listing.

 

Accompanied by Joyou''s vice president, Qingjian Liu, the government officials started the tour by visiting products on display in the Experience Hall. They admired the beautiful layout which raises sanitary ware presentation to a new level of aesthetics. The visitors heaped praise on the 1,500 m2 Experience Hall, which has nine exhibition areas and over 200 products on display and ranks among the largest exhibition centers of sanitary ware products in Asia.

 


 


While visiting the Kitchen Display Area, Shijie Li, the chief municipal inspector, said that the stainless steel sinks are ergonomically designed to fit the cupboard well. Moreover, the water tap not only looks elegant, but it can also rotate 360 degrees. A good combination of technology and ergonomics, intelligent sanitary ware products are more attractive for customers. Good examples being the intelligent toilets, message bathtubs and thermostatic shower pillars.

 



 
After the visit to the Experience Hall, the formal part of the meeting was held in Joyou''s conference room of the main office. The meeting was chaired by Yinglin Huang, the municipal governments deputy inspector. At the meeting, Qingjian Liu, Joyou''s vice president, expressed sincere gratitude to the government officials for their interest; he then summarized the development history of Joyou over the past 30 years while information concerning Joyou''s successful listing on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange on March 30 was reviewed. After a brief introduction, Guohong Jian, deputy secretary of the Quanzhou Municipal Bureau of Foreign Trade and Economic Cooperation, supported the Joyou European listing, and made an in-depth analysis and recommendations concerning how to better utilize overseas capital, expand overseas markets and cope with international trade barriers.

 


 


Shijie Li, the chief municipal inspector, concluded the meeting with a summary. He noted that special attention will be paid to listed enterprises since said enterprises not only can promote capital and talent internationalization, but also improve the modern enterprise operation and management as well as management level. He said that it was no small feat for Joyou to be listed on the Frankfort Stock Exchange – one of the largest financial exchanges in the world -- and he promised that support and help would be offered to Joyou by all government departments to help spur future development.

fields.title: Jilin Cai, Joyou''s COO, Awarded – Top Ten Outstanding Young Businessmen in China
fields.summary: At the Sixth annual China Industry Forum, recently held in the Great Hall of the People in Beijing, the list of China''s Industrial Economic Leaders for 2009 was announced. Mr. Jilin Cai, Joyou''s Chief..
fields.content:
At the Sixth annual China Industry Forum, recently held in the Great Hall of the People in Beijing, the list of China''s Industrial Economic Leaders for 2009 was announced. Mr. Jilin Cai, Joyou''s Chief Operating Officer was awarded for being among the Top Ten Outstanding Young Businessmen in China''s Industrial Economy.

 

As a high-level forum in China’s industrial economy sector, taking place inside China''s National Congress Building, the China Industry Forum has been successfully held for the past five years. Organized by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, the forum is also co-sponsored by China Industry News, Party Building Division of the CPC (Central Party School), and China Enterprises Management Association of Science Technology and Industry. This year’s forum theme was "Adapt to Change, Speed up infrastructure, and strengthen China’s industry".

 

According to the Chairman of this year’s China Industry Forum, Mr. Jilin Cai, Joyou''s Chief Operating Officer, fully meets the election criteria of “advancing China’s modern industrialization, daring to explore, innovation, making great contributions to the development of the national industrial economy and exerting significant social influence”. He also highly praised Mr. Jilin Cai, “who not only embodies Quanzhou merchants’ tradition of being adept in taking risks and daring to be a forerunner, but that he also actively pioneers in his own field and strives to make innovations, making Joyou a good example for other brands in China.”

 

As the representative of Fujian’s sanitary ware industry, Joyou designs, produces and sells faucets and other sanitary products. Joyou is one of China’s largest manufactures of sanitary ware products and accessories as well as one of the largest exporters of faucets and copper valve accessories in Asia. As the new generation leader of Joyou, in addition to the excellent qualities of credibility and combativeness inherited from his father Jianshe Cai, Jilin Cai also brings youthful talents of innovative management and aggressive brand promotion to the enterprise. After taking office, he took a series of bold reform measures, leading Joyou and its staff into a brand-new era.

 

In 2008, soon after taking office, Jilin Cai comprehensively analyzed the opportunities and challenges of the sanitary industry from a knowledgeable and unique perspective of an industrial leader. He made a forward-thinking decision to bring Joyou''s focus back from Europe to China, taking control of Joyou''s future by starting with building the Joyou brand. He employed brand consultants, established a marketing center, built-up comprehensive product lines, set aggressive marketing policies and participated in various types of large exhibitions. In the same year, the newly established Domestic Marketing Team, led by Jilin Cai, set up around 3000 sales points in all the first-tier and second-tier cities in China, and achieved sales revenue of over 1 billion yuan, setting a record and making him a legend in the sanitary ware industry.

 

On the heals of his first victory, Jilin Cai carried out the second phase of Joyou’s return to China which was dubbed “Joyou, Harmony with Water”. At the end of 2009 Joyou successfully invited Jingjing Guo to act as the brand ambassador for Joyou. The super star who has won multiple gold medals as a diving champion fits harmoniously with Joyou, jointly presenting the “ Art of water”. At the same time, Joyou adopted a whole-new national marketing campaign which greatly enhanced brand and channel promotion throughout the country. The most important move was to join forces with CCTV, China''s top TV Network. During the 2010 Dealer Meeting, Joyou teamed up with CCTV’s top entertainment program Happy Traveling Show across China. Chinese stars such as Song Zuying, Shin Band, Aloys Chen, Yu Quan, David Tao, Kelly Chen, SHE, Karen Mok, Julie Su and Han Hong and Olympic champions including Guo Jingjing, Zhang Xiangxiang, Zhao Ruirui and Lin Dan made appearances on the show while promoting the Joyou brand. Dong Qing, the leading CCTV anchorwoman took time to introduce Joyou during the show. The prime-time show, subtitled “Charmed by Joyou,” perfectly integrates brand promotion into a public entertainment show, instantly making the Joyou brand a household name that is well-known by consumers.

 

In order to speed up the fulfillment of the target of becoming the No. 1 sanitary brand in China, Jilin Cai made another clever move. At the end of 2009, Joyou announced a win-win cooperation with Germany-based Grohe, a leading global brand for sanitary products and systems, by establishing a Global Strategic Partnership. This new deal laid the groundwork to set up a Grohe Brand Business Unit within Joyou to jointly exploit the domestic and international markets. The move further enhanced the influence of the Joyou brand, providing advantageous resources and a broad platform for Joyou to fulfill the strategic development goal of brand globalization. Experts in the industry acclaim that Joyou offers an excellent example for Chinese sanitary brands to grow into internationally-known high-end brands.

 

The stage was set. On March 30, 2010, Joyou was successfully listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange, officially tapping into the global capital market, taking the brand global. As the first Chinese sanitary enterprise listed in the Prime Standard of a European country, the Joyou brand started the prelude of its capital upgrade. Since its IPO on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange, Joyou has been of great interest to investors. According to the report by Frankfurt Allgemeine Zeitung on March 30, 2010, Joyou was successfully listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange at the price of 14.75 euros, up 13.5% over the issue price. A total of 105 million euros were raised in the IPO, making Joyou the largest Chinese enterprise on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange.

 

According to Jilin Cai, the funds raised through IPO will be used to strengthen the enterprise’s R&D capability, brand building and promotion, and 1,000 new points of sale in China. Joyou will participate in more international exhibitions and introduce a modern sales management and CRM IT system as well as to strengthen the financial and risk management systems in a bid to have a bigger say in the international sanitary market.

 

Through the company’s listing on the Frankfurt Stock Market, Joyou has further consolidated its leading position in the industry. However, Jilin Cai is optimistic, yet cautious for the future. When receiving the Top Ten Outstanding Youths in China''s Industry award, he noted that China’s sanitary industry is flooded with enterprises. He forecast that the industry will become highly centralized and Chinese sanitary enterprises will tend to “extend outward” more, so they must improve their products’ environment friendliness, their brand’s added value and quality. He concluded saying, “it is compulsory for sanitary enterprises to improve R&D and IP protection if they aspire to go global. Joyou will further enhance its design ability and strive be a good example for other sanitary brands.”

fields.title: 2010 MTI Beauty Pageant – Joyou Sponsored Fujian Province Final
fields.summary: The ancient city of Quanzhou was taken over by some of the regions most beautiful young women. On the evening of April 16, 2010, contestants gathered in Quanzhou Culture and Art Center for the MTI, Mi..
fields.content:
The ancient city of Quanzhou was taken over by some of the regions most beautiful young women. On the evening of April 16, 2010, contestants gathered in Quanzhou Culture and Art Center for the MTI, Miss Tourism International, 2010 Fujian Division Final which is sponsored by Joyou.

 

Following the successful cooperation with CCTV''s prime-time hit TV programme “Pan-China Celebrity performance show” Joyou, a giant in China’s sanitary ware industry, sponsored the MTI Fujian Division Final jointly with Quanzhou Municipal Tourism Bureau and Miss Tourism International. Cooperation with MTI is an important part of Joyou''s brand promotion to support the marketing plan of becoming a household name throughout China by sponsoring popular cultural events.

 

 

High ranking local officials and Joyou Executives were on hand to witness the pageant which was covered by media outlets such as Fujian Channel of People CN, Fujian Reporters of Economic Daily, Quanzhou Evening, Dong Nan Zao Bao, Quanzhou TV, Quanzhou People''s Broadcasting Station, QZWB.Com, Ai Shang Quanzhou Weekly, Jinjiang Economic News, and Shishi Daily. The events popularity and the extensive coverage by the media make it a valuable marketing tool for the Joyou brand.

 

The Competition

 

On the night of the Final, 30 contestants gathered from three regions, Quanzhou, Fuzhou and Xiamen to compete for the title of Miss MTI Fujian. The contestants kicked off the show with a glamorous performance to get the audience excited and to show off their style and poise.

 

 

The MTI Fujian Division Final was divided into four parts: sportswear, swimwear, talent and evening wear. The theme for 2010 was “The Ocean”. Most contestants are students from colleges and universities, with an average age of 20 years old.

 

 

The stage of the evening party was bright and colorful and the two-hour competition offered non-stop entertainment and beautiful performances. During the Swimwear part of the show contestants showed grace and poise while wearing uniform swimsuits. For the Talent competition, the contestants delighted the crowd and the judges by singing, playing musical instruments and dancing. The competition came to a close with Evening Wear; the contestants wore their gowns with great elegance to comprehensively show their personality and artistic talent. The four parts of the competition gave a complete and balanced display of the contestants talent, poise and glamour which rubbed off on the the old historical host-city of Quanzhou.
 

 

 

After fierce competition, Lu Wang from Xiamen Jimei University was crowned Fujian Division MTI Beauty Queen 2010, while Muxing Bai from Xiamen University was runner-up and Nan Zhang from the College of Chemistry & Chemical Engineering took third place. They will represent Fujian in China''s National Final. Moreover, awards for Top Ten, Charity, Congeniality, Fashion, Best in Media, Best Talent, Best Performance, People’s Choice, Most Energetic Beauty and Best Figure were also chosen in this Final.

 

Fashion + Joyou This competition was held in Quanzhou, with the support from leaders of the Publicity Department of Quanzhou Municipal Committee, Quanzhou Tourism Bureau and Organizing Committee of Miss Tourism International. This Final is also a showcase for Minnan regional culture and the charming historical cultural city of Quanzhou for people in Fujian Province.

 


 

 

MTI Pageant organizers recognized Joyou for their support and cooperation. The MTI committee expressed that they were elated to work with Joyou, a sanitary ware leader in China, saying that Joyou''s high-quality, elegant products are a good match for the Miss Tourism International Event.

 

MTI, one of the top three international beauty contests, is well known for representing international exchange, cultural tourism, and fashion as well as many positive traits such as openness, progress, peace, friendship and beauty. Meanwhile, the global MTI is the first global event of its kind to be approved by authoritative institutions in China. Joyou felt honored to become the presenter of the MTI 2010 Fujian Division Final and the underlying enterprise of promoting tourism and fashion and its mission is to enable people to better understand Quanzhou''s open, cultural and charismatic side.

 

Qingjian Liu, Joyou''s vice president, said that the successful completion of this Final not only shows Joyou’s success in entertainment marketing of the Joyou brand through fashion competitions, but it also embodies Joyou’s devotion to public welfare projects and the perfect transformation of integrated marketing in Joyou. Meanwhile, it is also an acknowledgment of Joyou''s successful listing on the Frankfort Stock Exchange and a solid foundation for Joyou''s next round of rapid growth.

Contestants Make a splash at Joyou''s Headquarters

 

On April 17, the top ten contestants from the 2010 MTI Fujian Division Final visited the headquarters of Joyou.

 

 

Led by Qingjian Liu, Joyou''s vice president, the contestants visited the Joyou Experience Hall. The straightforward and elegant exhibition areas in the Joyou Experience Hall give a clear history of Joyou''s greatest achievements over 30 years where many products developed and produced by Joyou’s design team are on display.

 

 

Accompanied by employees, the contestants learned about research and development of kitchen sinks, metal taps and the entire suite of sanitary ware products. They also lauded the creative spirit of Joyou’s people to pursue extraordinary quality for their initiative. fields.title: Joyou''s 2010 May Day Party
fields.summary: On April 30, Joyou''s 2010 May Day Party, titled “Joyou’s Night”, was held to celebrate May Day – China''s Labor Day. A large list of dignitaries and journalists Joined Jianshe Cai, Joyou founder ..
fields.content:
On April 30, Joyou''s 2010 May Day Party, titled “Joyou’s Night”, was held to celebrate May Day – China''s Labor Day. A large list of dignitaries and journalists Joined Jianshe Cai, Joyou founder CEO, and Jilin Cai Joyou''s COO, who gathered with Joyou’s employees to celebrate May Day with music and dancing in a variety show.

 


 
 

 

The main square of the Joyou Industrial Complex was decked out with a stage and a large LED screen in the middle. On top of the stage, red neon lights reading “Joyou’s Night” were arranged. Colorful light strips and several spotlights were arranged at both sides of the stage to light up the performers. People from Joyou wearing red clothes came, ready for a good time.

 

At sunset, the party began with a passionate and dynamic performance titled “Don’t push me” which got the party going with music, dance, and enthusiastic applause from audiences.

 

The mood became more romantic with a love song performed by Lin Bin, a popular teacher from Fujian Normal University, which enchanted audiences.

 


 

 

Employees of Nan’an Brand of China Unicom performed an entertaining exotic Turkish belly dance making audiences feel as if they were in Turkey.

 

Soldiers from the PLA performed hip-hop, which showed their energetic positive outlook, full of vigor and vitality. It also is a good example of the colorful, laid-back lifestyle that this area of China is know for. Audiences found it fresh and new.

 

One of the highlights of the evening was a sketch written and performed by Joyou Employees called “Joyou - Our Family”. It was a touching story about employees in Joyou helping each other working hard to build a warm, welcoming home. The sketch touched Joyou''s employees who truly feel at home working together. The sketch ended with a birthday cake offered by the leadership of Joyou’s labor union to celebrate the birthday of its employees who start a new year every May Day.

 

 

In a more serious part of the evening, prizes were awarded to Outstanding Employees of 2009 to sincerely show appreciation for their efforts and contributions to the company in their posts, stimulating them to continue the hard work and to continue to set a good example for other employees.

 

The party continued with a variety of performances such as the patriotic song “Serve Country with Unreserved Loyalty”, a fan dance, poetry reading, a martial arts display, a sign language performance and a door-prize lottery draw, with constant applause and cheers from the audience.

 

 
 

 

The evening came to an end after three hours. Everyone enjoyed themselves thoroughly at a party celebrating Joyou’s staff, starting the holiday on a high note. It also encouraged employees and gave them energy to work together as a team and with renewed enthusiasm to start the new labor-year.

fields.title: Green Living Award
fields.summary: Guo, Jingjing, Olympic gold-medal winner and Joyou brand ambassador, was awarded with the title of “Ambassador for Water-saving Bathware Products.”
fields.content:
--Guo, Jingjing, Olympic gold-medal winner and Joyou brand ambassador, was awarded with the title of “Ambassador for Water-saving Bathware Products.” The 15th China International Kitchen & Bathroom Facilities Fair, the largest kitchen and bath exhibition in Asia, was held in Shanghai''s New International Expo Center (SNIEC).

 

At the fair, Joyou and its'' brand ambassador Guo, Jingjing, gave a water-conservation presentation in the Joyou booth. The event was jointly held with the Kitchen and Bath Engineering Committee of China Construction and Decoration Association, and Sohu (China''s leading on-line portal).

 

On hand for the event were Youhong Liu (the general secretary of National Technical Committee on Building and Sanitary Ceramics of Standardization Administration of China), Shiyan Gao (the general secretary of the Kitchen and Bath Engineering Committee of China Construction and Decoration Association), Yanan Hu (the assistant secretary general of the Kitchen and Bath Engineering Committee of China Construction and Decoration Association), Jianshe Cai (Joyou''s CEO), Jilin Cai (Joyou''s COO), Guo, Jingjing (Joyou''s Brand Ambassador and world-famous diving gold-medal winner), hundreds of dealer representatives and media reporters from throughout the country.

 

 

 

The presentation began with Jingjing Guo receiving a certificate of “Chinese Ambassador for Water-saving Bathware Products” from Youhong Liu and Shiyan Gao. After expressing her thoughts about the crucial need for water conservation, Guo, Jingjing demonstrated water-saving skills that could be integrated into everyones daily routine. Her enthusiasm for water conservation and her entertaining presentation brought continuous applause from the audience.

fields.title: Joyou and Grohe Jointly Exhibiting in Shanghai
fields.summary: The 15th China International Kitchen & Bathroom Facilities Fair got underway on May 26, 2010 in Shanghai. Joyou, a leading brand in China’s bathware industry, is exhibiting alongside Grohe, a global ..
fields.content:
Joyou and Grohe Jointly Exhibiting in Shanghai

 

As the film Oscars came to a close, the “Bathware Industry Oscars” were got under way. The 15th China International Kitchen & Bathroom Facilities Fair got underway on May 26, 2010 in Shanghai. Joyou, a leading brand in China’s bathware industry, is exhibiting alongside Grohe, a global high-grade tap brand, to showcase their products.

 

In this trade show, integrated bathroom suites are displayed with European and fashionable designs in the Joyou and Grohe exhibition halls with a total area exceeding 800m2. This is the first appearance of Joyou in this exhibition since its'' successful listing on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange, and it is an important step for Joyou to accelerate entry into Shanghai''s market.

 

Following a simple and elegant booth design, Joyou''s extensive series of skillfully manufactured product lines including taps, showers, bathtubs and complete integrated bathroom suites were on display, attracting lots of customers and investors.

 

In an interview, Jilin Cai, Joyou''s COO, said that consumers are more educated and that they could better grasp the idea of an integrated bathroom space in this exhibition. Through its products, service and creativity, Joyou is fully capable of creating high-quality European style bathware products for consumers and bringing the bathware industry to a new level.

fields.title: Joyou Awarded with the Advanced Water-saving Technology R&D Certificate
fields.summary: On May 26, 2010, Joyou was awarded with the certificate of “Advanced Water-saving Technology R&D” by the Kitchen and Bath Engineering Committee of China''s Construction and Decoration Association.
fields.content:
After continuous growth for over 30 years, Joyou enjoys a solid reputation for R&D in the industry. Thanks to the experience of foreign trade for more than two decades, Joyou''s products have satisfied the strict quality control requirements in European and American countries and passed through various international certifications such as USA NSF, UK WRAS, Europe CE and Canada CASS, with a ready market in nearly 20 countries and regions including the UK, USA, Canada, South East Asia and China. In 2008, Joyou shifted its center to China by marketing high-quality bathware with a European look for its consumers in China. Since then, Joyou has been awarded with such national titles as “China Top Brand Product” and “China Well-known Trademark.”

 


 

 

On May 26, 2010, Joyou was awarded with the certificate of “Advanced Water-saving Technology R&D” by the Kitchen and Bath Engineering Committee of China''s Construction and Decoration Association. This honor reflects the good reputation of Joyou’s brand among consumers and obtains support and recognition from all levels of the sanitary ware industry, which not only affirms the rapid and stable development of Joyou in recent years, but also represents a breakthrough by Joyou in branding development.

 

Jilin Cai, Joyou''s COO and forward thinking leader, has grown the Joyou brand while never forgetting social responsibility. Joyou has always focused on the R&D of bathware products to constantly innovate and optimize, while actively integrating its superior resources to promote the development of water-saving technology. Innovative breakthroughs in green technology promote the company''s healthy and rapid development. With its rapid appearance on the scene in the Chinese market, Joyou has attracted a lot of the industry''s attention by means of its brand strength and prominent product advantages, and deserves the Advanced Water-saving Technology R&D certification.

 

This certificate is also a powerful motivator for Joyou’s people, which affirms Joyou’s performance and pushes them to continuously innovate for consumers, the society and the environment with a goal of continuing the long-held mission to create environment-friendly, healthy and high-quality bathware products. Environmentally friendly lead-free taps represent Joyou''s promise to consumers for high quality standards.

 

 

Jilin Cai went on to say that Joyou would continue to focus on R&D and innovation in its goal to establish a water-saving culture while also creating “hundred-year quality”, and treat its research and development of energy conservation products as a priority. He concluded by noting that this can be achieved by actively promoting the implementation of water-saving technology projects, and speeding up cooperation with colleges and universities, thereby creating more healthy and environment-friendly products for consumers.

Beauty Queens Exhibit Joyou’s Products at Shanghai Exhibition

fields.content:
Joyou opens offices and exhibition space in Beijing



Hamburg, 2 December 2010. In line with the company’s growth strategy, Joyou Group has opened a 1,200 sqm office in Beijing, commercial district. 50 people will be working in the new office that comprises an exhibition space for Grohe and Joyou faucets and sanitary ware products, with a approximately 600 sqm dedicated to commercial concept showrooms.

Beijing in the centre for commercial property developers in Northern China: A large cluster of property developers have their head offices here. Accordingly, Joyou opens this office with the intention of fostering Joyou and Grohe sales with the commercial property developers in the Northern provinces and across China. This will assist expansion into this sector that makes up a large portion of the overall market for faucets and other sanitary ware in China.

The company further opened a 900 sqm office in Xiamen, Fujian Province, where 70 people will be working. It will hold the international sales department, and sales staff focusing on Grohe sales in Eastern China.

“In the first nine months 2010 Joyou opened 989 new points of sale in China and expect to open more than 90 additional stores in the fourth quarter. This is in line with objective stated at the IPO to open 1,000 new shops this year. In addition to this, the new offices in Beijing and Xiamen further strengthen our expansion infrastructure to handle the growth. We see very good opportunities in the commercial project business with real estate developers for the Joyou and Grohe products,” states Jianshe CAI, CEO Joyou AG.
